oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Outdoor canteen of the National League for Woman's Service, Chalons-Sur-Marne, France
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rankin, Anne Porterfield, 1887-1941
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For current rights information, please visit: http://idserver.utk.edu/?id=200600000001200
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Outdoor canteen of the National League for Woman's Service. The watercooler has the business logo of Crystal Springs in the Catskill Mountains. Soldiers eat at outdoor tables under tents, served by women of the National League for Woman's Service. A notation on the back of the photograph places the location as Chalons-Sur-Marne ARC Canteen, France.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918 -- Women.

Wars and Military.
